questions.question: Which of the following is not a property of a Red-Black Tree?
options: Every node is either red or black
If a node is red, then both its children are black
Every simple path from a node to a descendant leaf has the same number of black nodes

questions.question: In a B-Tree of order m, what is the maximum number of children a node can have?
Which of the following is a disadvantage of using hash tables?
In the context of a graph, what does 'DAG' stand for?
What is the worst-case time complexity of inserting an element in a Fibonacci Heap?
Which algorithm is not typically used for graph traversal?
What is the space complexity of a simple adjacency list representation of a graph with n vertices and e edges?
In AVL trees, what is the maximum difference allowed between the heights of the left and right subtrees of any node?
options: Logarithmic in terms of the number of nodes
Dependent on the height of the tree

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement about Splay Trees?
options: Recently accessed elements are moved to the root
Balance of the tree is always maintained
All operations have a worst-case time complexity of O(log n)
It is a type of self-balancing binary search tree
Insertion and deletion operations are not allowed

questions.question: In the Knuth-Morris-Pratt (KMP) algorithm, what is the purpose of the 'partial match' table?
options: To record the positions of matches found
To determine the next characters to be matched
To skip unnecessary comparisons when a mismatch occurs
To track the current position in the search string
To maintain the longest prefix which is also a suffix
